ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.2_0: Now at that time the senior monks were taking turns to advise the nuns.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.2_1: At that time Venerable Cūḷapanthaka was able to advise the nuns.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.3_0: And the nuns said, “Now the instruction will be effective, Venerable Cūḷapanthaka would that has not been effected again and again.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.4_0: Then those nuns went to Cūḷapanthaka
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.4_1: They bowed, sat down to one side,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.5_0: Cūḷapanthaka then said to them, “Are you all present, Sisters?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.7_0: “Are you keeping the eight important principles?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.9_0: After saying, “This is the instruction,” he spoke the same utterance again and again:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.10_0: A sage of higher consciousness, diligent,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.11_0: training in the ways to sagacity:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.12_0: there are no sorrows for such a one,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.14_0: And the nuns said, “Didn’t we say that the instruction wouldn’t be effective, that Venerable Cūḷapanthaka would just be repeating the same utterance over and over?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.15_0: Venerable Cūḷapanthaka heard this discussion between the nuns.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.16_0: He then rose up into the air, walked back and forth in space, and he stood, sat down, and lay down there. He emitted smoke and fire, and he disappeared, all the while speaking the same utterance and many other sayings by the Buddha.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.19_0: No previous instruction has been as effective as this one from Venerable Cūḷapanthaka!”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.20_0: And Cūḷapanthaka kept on instructing those nuns until the dark of night, and then dismissed them, saying, “Go, Sisters.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.21_0: Then, when the nuns had been deposited outside the town gates, they entered the town gates and city.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.22_0: People complained and criticized them, “These nuns aren’t celibate.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.23_0: They spend the night in the monastery with the monks and only now do they enter the town.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.24_0: The monks heard the complaints of those people
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.25_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.26_0: “How can Venerable Cūḷapanthaka instruct the nuns sunshades?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.27_0: “Is it true, Cūḷapanthaka, that you did this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.30_0: “... Cūḷapanthaka, how can you do this?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.31_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.32_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.33.1_0: ‘Even if he has been agreed upon, if a monk instructs the nuns after sunset, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:2.1.2_0: Has been agreed upon through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:2.1.4_0: after the sun has gone down.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:2.1.6_0: she has been given the full ordination by both Sanghas.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:2.1.8_0: if he instructs in the eight important principles or he gives any other teaching, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:2.2.1_0: If the sun has set, and he perceives that it has, and he instructs the nuns, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:2.2.2_0: If the sun has set, but he is unsure of it, and he instructs the nuns, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:2.2.3_0: If the sun has set, but he perceives that it has not, and he instructs the nuns, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:2.2.4_0: If he instructs a nun who is fully ordained only on one side, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:2.2.5_0: If the sun has not set, but he perceives that it has, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:2.2.6_0: If the sun has not set, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:2.2.7_0: If the sun has not set, and he perceives that it has not, there is no offense.

ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:2.3.4_0: when he is reinstated, he promises him.

ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:2.3.7_0: if he is speaking for the benefit of someone else and the nuns listen in;
